question: Premium
text:
Premium
          
        
A premium is the amount you pay for your health insurance every month. In addition to your premium, you usually have to pay other costs when accessing healthcare services, including 
deductibles
, 
co-payments
, 
and
 
co-insurance
. 
If you have a health plan through Pennie, you may be able to lower your monthly premium with a premium tax credit. After you enroll in a plan, you must pay your first premium directly to the insurance company - not to Pennie.
When shopping for a plan, keep in mind that the plan with the lowest monthly premium may not be the best match for you. If you plan on using your healthcare frequently, a plan with a slightly higher premium but a lower deductible may save you a lot of money.
